title: Calories in One Scrambled Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in one scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled with 1 tsp butter or oil, no added salt or milk.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients like milk or cheese. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled egg provides ~91 kcal and ~7 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter or oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.7 g protein per large scrambled egg.
Very lowâ€”about 0.5 g carbs per egg, with 0 g fiber.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Added butter, oil, or milk increases calories; nonstick without fat lowers them.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Yes, around 205 mg, mostly from the yolk.
